app.components.AboutPageComponents.beaut: What’s the connection with Beautiful Trouble + ActionAid?
app.components.AboutPageComponents.defin:
# DEFINITION
We’ve conducted six ‘jam sessions’ around the world with diverse groups of activists to better understand the problems they’re facing and generate locally relevant content for the toolbox.
app.components.AboutPageComponents.inspi:
# INSPIRATION
This toolbox was inspired by the [Beautiful Trouble book and website](http://beautifultrouble.org/). The scope has been expanded to involve a more diverse group of activists as both makers and users of the toolkit.

app.components.AboutPageComponents.ourPr: HOW DID WE MAKE THE TOOLBOX?
app.components.AboutPageComponents.proto:
# PROTOTYPING
In each jam session, low-fidelity prototypes of the toolbox were presented to activists to take apart and put back together based on their needs and challenges.
app.components.AboutPageComponents.reali:
# REALIZATION
Early prototypes evolved into multiple iterations of what’s currently a [game](https://beautifulrising.org/platforms/game), [chatbot](https://beautifulrising.org/platforms/chatbot), and website. With your help, the content and the form will continue to evolve!
app.components.Footer.footer: Beautiful Rising by Beautiful Rising, various authors is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License. Permissions beyond the scope of this license may be available at [beautifulrising.org](//beautifulrising.org). Documentation for the application programming interface (API) that powers Beautiful Rising can be [found on GitHub](https://github.com/BeautifulTrouble/api-docs#api-documentation-for-the-various-beautiful-projects).
app.components.OnboardingContent.btaa: what's the connection with beautiful trouble + actionaid?
app.components.OnboardingContent.howDidW: How did we make the toolbox?
app.components.OnboardingContent.onboard: Yeah I got this. Just take me to the toolbox!
app.components.OnboardingContent.welcome: Beautiful Rising seeks to strengthen the capacity, creativity, and effectiveness of social movements, activist groups, and civil society organizations to achieve lasting social change.
app.components.PlatformsMenu.subheader: Explore other ways to access the toolbox
app.components.ToolSnapshotArea.callOut: Hey, so far this principle is only summarized — but people like you are likely using it in all kinds of ways. Do you have insights to share on how to use this principle? Go ahead and share them through the form below...
app.components.ToolTypeArea.methodologie: Strategic frameworks and hands-on exercises to help you assess your situation and plan your campaign.

“If you don't know where you’re going, you'll end up someplace else.” ―Yogi Berra Tactics are fun, but if you haven’t first identified goals and mapped out your strategy for how to achieve them, even the most engaging tactic won’t get you closer to where you want to go. That’s where these exercises and strategic frameworks come in: they are tools to help you better understand your situation, plan your next steps, assess your progress, and, eventually, win.
app.components.ToolTypeArea.principlesDe: Time-tested guidelines for how to design successful actions and campaigns.
app.components.ToolTypeArea.principlesLo: After decades of battles won and lost, veteran creative activists tend to acquire a set of mental shortcuts for how to design successful actions and campaigns. These hard-won insights are not strict rules, but rather loose guidelines to keep in mind as you design your own actions.
app.components.ToolTypeArea.storiesDesc: Accounts of memorable actions and campaigns, analysing what worked, or didn’t, and why.
app.components.ToolTypeArea.storiesLong: Revolutionaries practice without safety nets. Our laboratory is the world around us – the streets, the Internet, the airwaves, our own hearts. We experiment, we fail, we readjust, we try again, maybe this time a little less disastrously, a little more beautifully – until eventually, we win. Always we learn. In these stories we share what we’ve learned.
app.components.ToolTypeArea.tacticsDesc: Specific forms of creative action, such as a flash mob or blockade.
app.components.ToolTypeArea.tacticsLong: Every discipline has its forms of action: ballet dancers lunge and pirouette; boxers throw jabs and uppercuts. Likewise, creative activists have their own forms of action. Some, like a sit-in, march or picket line, have been used for generations. Others, like flash mobs and hashtag campaigns, are recent innovations. As with ballet or boxing, a single tactic, no matter how well executed, rarely wins the day. Victory comes, if it comes, through creative combination and variation.
app.components.ToolTypeArea.theoriesDesc: Big-picture ideas that help us understand how the world works and how we might change it.
app.components.ToolTypeArea.theoriesLong: “There’s nothing so practical as a good theory.” —George Lakey Ever wished someone would take the most important ideas from revolutionary thinkers like Paulo Freire, Arundhati Roy, and Antonio Gramsci, and cook them down into fierce, accessible nuggets of theory, tailored to the pragmatic needs of the everyday troublemaker? Look no further.
app.components.ToolTypeSelectedFull.head: This is the ToolTypeSelectedFull component !
app.components.ToolsRequestTraining.requ: You can also request a Beautiful Rising training
app.containers.AboutPage.description: Beautiful Rising harnesses the insights of changemakers worldwide to help make our movements more strategic, creative and effective.
app.containers.AskTheContributor.emailPl: Enter your email for the contributor to get back to you
app.containers.ContributePage.typeOfCont: WHAT TYPE OF CONTENT WOULD YOU LIKE TO CONTRIBUTE?
app.containers.EmailTools.complete: Email successfully sent! Please check your email
app.containers.EmailTools.instruction: Type your email below and send these modules to your inbox
app.containers.EmptyToolsMessage.header: You can save your go-to tools here, so that the next time you access the toolbox you don’t need to go searching for them all over again.
app.containers.EmptyToolsMessage.instruc: Click on the {icon} to save your favourite tools here. (No need to log in; your list will be here the next time you visit from the same device.)
app.containers.NewsFeed.header: We pull various newsworthy hashtags associated with different campaigns and movements to keep you in the loop with what’s happening in the world of activism!
app.containers.SearchField.placeholder: Search for keywords, ex: legislation, state repression, etc.
app.containers.SubmitNewsFeed.header: IS THERE A HASHTAG THAT WE SHOULD BE AWARE OF? LET US KNOW...
app.containers.SubmitRealWorldExample.he: Have you seen or used this {type}?
app.containers.SubmitRealWorldExample.in: Great! Share that experience with us in the form of a link and if it’s a solid example we’ll feature it in the section above
app.containers.SubmitRealWorldExample.ti: Give a short title for your example
app.containers.SubmitRealWorldExample.ur: copy + paste the url of the video, image, gif, audio
app.containers.ToolPage.removeTool: Remove this from your saved tools
